intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius subrotundiforme, commonly known as the blunt-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its rosette of broad, rounded leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in meadows and grasslands. The plant is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss. It plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
